subject: RE: [junit] Junit and RMI, please help ...
msgSnippet: Sam, ... sidenote: from javadoc Object.equals(): For any non-null reference value x, x.equals(null) should return false. ... I do not understand how you want
messageBody:
Sam,

> Hello all again,
>
> Still awaiting somebody would lend a helping hand. I have a
> simple RMI
> server providing database service supported by a one-file,
> non-relational
> database. Database clients pass their object reference to
> the server when
> connecting, and so the server can detect a dead connection by
> the following
> if-statement and
> recycles the connection for another client:
>
> if (clientObject != null && clientObject.equals(null)) { ... }

---
sidenote:
from javadoc Object.equals():
"For any non-null reference value x, x.equals(null) should return false."
----


I do not understand how you want to test for a dead client.

How do you define "dead connection"? If the client process died
(closing the shell) or an inactive client?

If the client process is killed by the OS then the TCP connection
is closed. So an exception will be thrown on the server.
Can you catch this exception? If this is true then mock the connection
and have the mock connection throw this exception in your test.

However if the tcp connection is not closed properly (client disconnected
from net,
client OS crashed, ...) the server ist not informed by the tcp layer about
it. For such cases you will have to add functionality to your server to
actively detect them by a call to a client's method.


Bernd

> Right now, I just open a few OS shells (Windows XP) and run
> the clients to
> connect to the server, manually close a shell, and check the println
> statements I placed in the server to see that it is indeed
> working. It would
> be great if a TestCase can simulate that.
>
> Thanks in advance.
>
> Sam
